metadata.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a circus worker on the checkpoint after the player is allowed to enter. He has a friendly circus ghoul with him to check on the entering customers.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use the debug book to got to Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. You will be teleported to directly outside the circus gates - click on the ghoul or the man next to him to start the checkpoint, then speak to this character afterwards to get these lines.

0.speaker: Klaus
0.text: I heard what you did - about Dribbles. He is... was, a good egg. Thank you, for making sure no one else got hurt.
0.context: NodeContext: not his chirpy self - reserved and sincere

1.speaker: Klaus
1.text: I know it's hard to enjoy the circus without Dribbles, but I pray that you do. After all, the show must go on.
1.context: NodeContext: trying to be cheerful but a little sad. He misses dribbles

2.speaker: Klaus
2.text: Do you hear that? The screaming? Damn it, I can't leave my post. If you can, please go in and help!
2.context: NodeContext: Sincere, pleading, worried about the other staff inside

3.speaker: Klaus
3.text: What are you doing wasting time with me? There's a circus to enjoy, my friend! Go on.

4.speaker: Klaus
4.text: A tip? Don't piss off the djinni. Oh, and if the kobold tries to sell you food? Run. Enjoy the circus!
4.context: NodeContext: first half low and conspiratorial (player should wonder if he's just messing with him), second half cheerful.
